name: Tailwind
description: I have a good understanding of Tailwind CSS, which is a utility-first CSS framework that allows for fast and efficient web design. I can use Tailwind to create responsive, clean, and customizable designs with minimal effort. By applying utility classes directly in HTML, I can quickly style elements without writing custom CSS. I’ve worked on several projects using Tailwind, which has helped me develop a strong grasp of creating modern, responsive web interfaces efficiently. My portfolio website is built using Tailwind CSS, which helped me create a clean, responsive, and modern design. By utilizing Tailwind’s utility-first approach, I was able to efficiently style the website without writing extensive custom CSS. This allowed me to focus on creating a user-friendly interface and ensuring the design is adaptable across different screen sizes. Tailwind’s flexibility and ease of use played a key role in bringing my portfolio to life with a polished, professional look.

name: GitHub

This version control system is crucial for efficient teamwork and ensuring code integrity throughout development. Additionally, my portfolio and other projects are stored and versioned on GitHub, showcasing my ability to manage and organize codebases.
